content.description: Stand start on the left side of the boulder and follow slopers to the point. Great change of pace from the usual pockets and crimps. Classic line.
content.location: Main face of the rope swing boulder.

content.description:
Sit start and follow the ledge until the crack, then climb straight to the top. 

 There are two variations which involve climbing straight to the top of the boulder at the crack:  

 1.) A compression ("bear hug") variation. It involves finding a right-hand hold on the underside where Banana Man starts, with the left hand on the ledge. 

 2.) A two-handed, ledge-only variation. More difficult than the compression start.
content.protection: Crash pads, spotter. Watch out for the ledge above the water.

content.description: Simple overhanging boulder problem. Good starting hands (match in the pocket) and feet. Crux is the mantle.
content.protection: Crash pads, spotter. Watch out for the ledge above the water.

content.description: Stout boulder with problems ranging from V2-V5. It sits on a flat landing area which rolls off to the creek below.
